author: {'steamid': '76561198068064305', 'num_games_owned': 244, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 858, 'last_played': 1435676228}
review: Even though this game is very early in development, I highly recommend it! The concept is great. Everyone starts out in the spawn building, and when the round starts, you scavange the environment for food, water, weapons, and ammo. After finding the supplies you need, you start to begin the hunt for other players. Trying to survive is tough enough, but playing offense adds another dimension to this game. This game is truely kill or be killed. Yes it is buggy. Yes the animations are hilarious. But also, yes, this game is fun! And it will only get better!

author: {'steamid': '76561198074768974', 'num_games_owned': 581, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1452367245}
review:
I bought this game for 20 euros, or however much it cost, when it first entered early access. (Obviously I regret that now.) 
I eagerly followed the development, I was all about this game. A Hunger Games style video game with survival elements? F@$k yeah!
I liked it, even when it was buggy and the animations were abysmal. I liked it. 
But as time went on, and the same bugs and s***y animations stayed, the game started to lose is spark in me.

Well now it has "released", and I've come to realize that it never was as good as I made it out to be. It's clunky, glitchy, and barely anyone plays it. I guess we'll just have to wait for something better. Some other game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012512624', 'num_games_owned': 65, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1429924870}
review:
I really like the concept of this game. This is essentially a battle royale standalone. However, the game is very wonky at the moment, which I am sure will get fixed throughout the early access.

Character movement is a little wonky I will admit, it just has this unappealing feel to it. Looking through the cabinets is also a bit strange especially when you look down, it has this odd view to it. 

I managed to play one game so far, as there are very few players at the time, it is very difficult to get into a match. A match seems to require 10 players.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152644429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2100, 'last_played': 1436259072}
review:
Also ich spiele das Spiel schon seid 20 Std. und muss sagen, ich bin begeistert! 
Am Anfang ist es noch sehr frustrierend, da man überhaupt kein Plan hat wo was liegt und was man tun soll und gleich so ein Typ mit ner Axt kommt und dich umhaut.
Doch mit immer mehr Runden die man gespielt hat wird man immer besser und entdeckt viel mehr. 
Trotz vieler Bugs ist das Spiel jetzt schon gut spielbar und macht sehr sehr viel Spaß.
Das Spiel hat soviel Potential und hat im Moment leider zu wenig Aufmerksamkeit, sodass es ein wenig dauert bis man genügend Spieler zusammen hat. Aber dafür gibt es auch einen Trick (einfach in den Server rein gehen, get ready drücken, dann wieder rausgehen und wieder das gleiche machen. So kriegt man es hin, dass man auch zu zewit spielen kann.)

Also definitiv holen! Es kann nur besser werden :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197999892157', 'num_games_owned': 1842, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1422726884}
review:
Wow... Ok here we go with my honest first impressions

Waited in a lobby for 22 minutes... went down to 0 people needed, waited 5 more minutes, figured it was bugged and left. Game was closed because it was in progress. Waited another 16 minutes in another lobby finally in ok cool.

Hilariously awful animations aside this is a list of bugs I had in 4 games.

Climbing an invisible ladder into the sky
Eating my food as I pick up a gun unintentionally
Scoped in with snipe makes me fall through the map
Got stuck on the upstairs of a hour because the stairs were too high
latency so bad the one gun fight I get into we both die because we lagged so bad

Bugs aside the map is extremely bland and unappealing, the chacters run like they have dingleberries attached to every hair on their body. The food and water go down so quick it becomes a more of race for survival than an actual competitive fps, you'll spend more time in lobbies than the actual game.

Overall AVOID this like the plague unless you only want to support the devs because this is NOT a fun prodcut in it's current form.

Here is video format of my experience.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OyGFmzIxXKg

author: {'steamid': '76561198023141026', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1423147964}
review:
Bon je crois que je suis tombé sur le pire jeu de l'année 2015.

Dommage parce que l'idée de transposer au jeu un genre battle roayle est excellent.

Le jeu est injouable en l'état. Graphiquement on dirait un jeu des années 2000, genre un bon vieux counter strike.

Il est certes en alpha mais je regrette d'avoir perdu 15 euros pour un jeu que je n'ai même pas encore pu tester. 

Coté serveurs, c'est la catastrophe ultime. Impossible de se connecter malgré les 2 patchs balancés en urgence. Je pense que les développeurs font de leur mieux, mais je crois qu'il eu mieux valu repousser la sortie du jeu plutôt que de proposer une alpha injouable. Après tout le but d'une alpha est de tester le jeu en conditions réelles, sauf que là on ne peut pas :(

Je pense que les développeurs vont encore ramer pour nous fournir un jeu stable, mais pour les aspects graphiques, je crois que c'est d'ores et déjà trop tard.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997172478', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1013, 'playtime_forever': 1178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 991, 'last_played': 1452247949}
review:
[h1] Eat,drink - find weapons and kill [/h1].

Wow, it's strange that so much time must have passed for someone to finally use such a great idea as fighting to the death in a closed zone.

In the era of popularity of survival games and the rash of dayZ, warz, h1z1 and a thousand other creations, no one thought to do such a survival but in the light version, where players are locked in an area and have to kill each other - the last one wins. That's what Down To One is.

Locked in an area about the size of a large Battlefield map, we have to survive and kill at the same time. Everyone is gathered in the center of the map in a kind of prison, when the game starts - the cell opens and we run out into the world, where we run depends on us - if we choose a military base we run the risk that someone will come a moment before us, find a gun and kill us, and even if we get there first we still run the risk of running out of food and water - every round means making a decision - is it safer to run to an abandoned hut where we can find provisions and a knife or run to the military base to arm ourselves with a super weapon at the risk of being shot or dying of starvation.

Another factor that makes the game more difficult is the artillery fire and the fact that every few minutes the area of the map in which we can play decreases - which is logical - the fewer players left alive, the closer the barrier is to the center - which forces the player to find new hiding places and the awareness that the barrier will soon decrease, so other players will also run out of their hiding places - to hunt them down or do everything not to be hunted.

To customize the character we have available perks, camouflages, you can have three active, they are divided into categories such as defense, attack, survival, etc. New perks are unlocked through experience, which we get during the game for killing and surviving as long as possible. 

The game in its current alpha version offers one map - but it has something that many other games lack - developers.
Developers who polish the game every day, people who sit on the forum 24/7 write back almost immediately, all the time you can play with developers on the servers, talk and discuss what to add, change and rewrite.
They can even add two patches a day.

Now the drawbacks because every game has them - this is the Alpha as of February 2015 so it's possible that as you read this the problems in question don't exist, but - the current animations which are mega silly weird and funny in their own way relieve the atmosphere and give some laughs while waiting for the opening of the objective - but still they should be more normal. In addition, the game's HUD, which is supposed to be minimalistic, is a big drawback for me.The number of pre-mites and weapons is awfully small for a game of this type.
One simple map and problems with joining the server, because when the game is running you can't even join the waiting room.
I also miss the fact that there is no option for everyone to respawn in a random place on the map - currently everyone is born in the middle and everyone runs in the direction of their choice - it kind of spoils the opportunity to do ambushes, etc. when we see where many people have gone. 

I'm satisfied with this game, it has great potential that can not be wasted, at the moment I would not buy the full price, but in the promotion I would - if the developers really develop it will be a solid competition for Dayz and h1z1

author: {'steamid': '76561198015790280', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 663, 'last_played': 1686538146}

author: {'steamid': '76561197961397363', 'num_games_owned': 794, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1442096863}
review:
Wer kennt das nicht: Man spielt ne Runde DayZ oder irgend nen anderen Survival Multiplayer Titel, will einfach nur überleben und ZACK kommt ein anderer Spieler um die Ecke und jagd dir ne Kugel in den Kopf...Dooof
Wer dagegen der andere Spieler war^^, wird mit Down to One seine Freude haben!
Einfach mal hier reinschauen:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=baUNHQ1LaIU&feature=youtu.be

Wie bei den Hungergames starten alle Spieler zusammen. Wenn die Runde startet heißt es schnellstmöglich eine Waffe finden und die anderen Spieler umlegen. Der letzte Überlebende gewinnt! Aber nicht nur die gegnerischen Spieler sind tötlich sondern auch Durst und Hunger. Man muss also auch Verpflegung suchen und sich ab und zu verarzten wenn man verletzt wurde.
Momentan ist das spiel in der Version 0,15c , also eine sehr frühe Version. ICH (ich will für niemanden anderen Sprechen) hatte keine Bugs, kann das Spiel also genießen. Die Grafik ist in Ordnung, aber eher Indi;) Der sound ist soweit auch ganz gut. Die Steuerung ist teilweise noch etwas hakelig. Insgesamt macht das Spiel einen runden technischen Eindruck. Ich hatte übrigens KEINE Lags. find ich super! Die Animationen sind noch sehr lustig^^ Aber das wird schon noch^^

Die Runden sind trotz der recht großen Karte max. 20-25 Minuten lang. Über dem Spielfeld ist ein Energiedome der nach und nach immer kleiner wird. Die Spieler werden also immer dichter zusammengedrängt. Die Action steigt also gegen Ende der Runde.
Außerdem gibt es noch ein Erfahrungssystem mit Perks. Nach einer Runde gibts XP und man kann im Level aufsteigen. 3 PErks können gleichzeitig aktiv sein, z.B. das die Essensanzeige langsamer abnimmt etc. Bin gespannt was da noch so kommen wird
Ich hab meinen Spaß mit dem Spiel!

author: {'steamid': '76561198053422627', 'num_games_owned': 2391, 'num_reviews': 1237, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1452287800}
review:
This game quickly died and saw the price drop to just 99 cents.

The servers are dead now and have been for years.

It was a good idea back in early 2015, made the kid that made this game a load of cash, but like so many asset reliant battle royale games over the years, it quickly died.

The animations were soooo bad, lol.  Half the time you killed someone, you couldn't get their dropped loot.  Just a mess, but hey.. it was a cool idea when it came out.


Have a look at my 2nd game of 'Down To One' ...This was recorded in January of 2015 at launch.  (My video recording software didnt record any voice or game sound so I just added music) :
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q1K0gDOOQg4

Devs u need to do somthing before its to late and everyone like myself who like playing give up hope all togeather.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048128820', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1450338919}
review:
Ever wanted to go hiking in a breathtaking barren desert with your friends? If so this is the game for you! 
But there's a slight twist! Death can be iminent in seconds! The perfect game to teach you how to survive in the desert!
By putting you in the boots of a trained soldier! The perfect touch of realistic survival and 
an endless exploration factor of dirt and rocks! Will you survive in the harsh desert? Or become
a victim of the brutal elements and selfishness of other players? 11/10 best desert explorer of 2015!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011397584', 'num_games_owned': 414, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1432093460}
review:
I followed this game for a while, and decided to pop back in and drop a negative review.. If this was based solely on the devs, this game would be a 9/10.

Unfortunately, having paid 15$ original price for this game and attempting to actually play, I can say I need some money back... 

Devs WERE awesome.. But not anymore, they gave up on this one, dropped the price to a 15th of what it originally was..

Idk, but I feel like I was duped a little bit.
